pullRequest.title: Change `asyncPropagating` default to true
pullRequest.bodyText: Historically, we required setting a flag on the scope in order for async propagation to continue working.  This is a bad experience and a source of headaches.  With other changes in place, we are no longer as sensitive to over aggressive propagation, so we can change the default.  In the future we would like to remove this setting altogether.

beforeCommit.message:
Cleanup and fix tests

Disable netty request retry and update the host... This helps reduce extra spans that we aren't expecting.

Add test instrumentation to break propagation to the embedded test Elasticsearch instance.

afterCommit.message:
Cleanup and fix tests

Disable netty request retry and update the host... This helps reduce extra spans that we aren't expecting.

Add test instrumentation to break propagation to the embedded test Elasticsearch instance.

nodes.bodyText: Could you add a comment to explain why this is necessary?
Could you add a comment to explain how this differs from the other ElasticsearchBreakTraceInstrumentation?
Could you add a comment to explain how this differs from the other ElasticsearchBreakTraceInstrumentation?
Could you add a comment to explain how this differs from the other ElasticsearchBreakTraceInstrumentation?
Could you add a comment to explain how this differs from the other ElasticsearchBreakTraceInstrumentation?

How do we avoid diffs like this? One option is for you to uninstall the plugin which edits code unrelated to the change you've made when you save files as I believe you are now in a minority in using it. If we want consistent formatting of test files, note that I run ./gradlew spotlessApply before I commit every time I commit, but reformatting of test files is disabled; I think it should have been enabled. The status quo is unsustainable.

nodes.bodyText: Hmm. Why is this necessary? Is this a new gotcha? This definitely needs a comment now.

I wasn't expected the set to true blocks to be removed in this first step.
I was assuming we just set async propagation will to true and that's it.

commit.message:
Revert "Remove unnecessary usage of `setAsyncPropagation(true)`"

This reverts commit b437fe7d41cc9699d217e0e30515a66aeb736342.

Cleanup and fix tests

Disable netty request retry and update the host... This helps reduce extra spans that we aren't expecting.

Add test instrumentation to break propagation to the embedded test Elasticsearch instance.
Add constant to enable quick switching of default
